result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) was dismissed by the court.

  • Kenneth J. Miller was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Prior to re-licensing the defendant is to complete an OWI Assessment.

miscConds.notes: Court orders bond on file applied. Balance of costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.
Defendant is to comply with any rules/recommendations as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

timeConds.notes: With Huber and Good Time Credit.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kenneth J. Miller

records.addlTxt: Documents verified with scanning; Paper file destroyed, retained electronically (scanned)-tpg

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Defendant Kenneth J. Miller in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Steven P. Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Agreement reached and stated on record. Defendant concurs. Court addresses right to preliminary hearing. Defendant wishes to waive right to preliminary hearing. Court accepts waiver of right to preliminary hearing, has read the complaint and finds probable cause a felony has been committed within the courts jurisdiction and enters an order binding the defendant over for trial. Information filed. Attorney Szilagyi confirms receipt, waives formal reading.   Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: No Contest to Count 1.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Court dismisses outright Count 2 and DRI 14TR1523. Statement by defendant. Court sentences the defendant to: SWD and places the defendant on probation for a period of 2 years. CONDITIONS: 6 months WCJ, to begin forthwith, with Huber and Good Time Credit. 48 hour warning given. Credit for 11 days served. AODA and follow through, Absolute Sobriety, No Bars, Not to ingest any impairing substances without a valid prescription from a treating physician, $2000.00 Fine inclusive of costs, $42.50 blood draw costs assessed, 30 mo DL Revocation, 30 mo IID, OWI Assessment, Terms of Agent. Court orders cash bond to be applied, balance to be paid within 60 days or payment plan. Appeal Rights Given.
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 5, 2014 at 11:00 am.
from Atty Szilagyi requesting adjournment - Granted by the court
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 18, 2014 at 11:45 am.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Ben Szilagyi in court.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Szilagyi requesting a P/S date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 18, 2014 at 11:45 am.
Status conference on October 17, 2014 at 03:10 pm.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Case Called @ 1:14 PM: Defendant Kenneth J. Miller in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Steven Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading waived.  Court entertains waiver of time limits for pre-lim hearing.  Court accepts knowing and voluntary waiver of 20 day time limits for pre-lim hearing.  STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Status conference scheduled for October 17, 2014 at 03:10 pm.
Initial appearance on September 9, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
from SPD Szilagyi Re: Rescheduling of 8/20/14 IA
Initial appearance on August 20, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.  No operation of any motor vehicles without a valid driver's license.

Case called @ 1:04 p.m. Defendant Kenneth J. Miller in court, in custody, appears via video with attorney Bryan D. Keberlein.  Steven Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. Defendant will be represented by SPD pending verification. ADA Anderson requesting $1000 Cash Bond. Atty Keberlein requesting signature bond or lower cash bond. Court orders $1000 Cash Bond.  IA Scheduled - NOH Given.  Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Initial appearance scheduled for August 20, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
